fields.name: Band 10.1: Driving Offences
fields.description: Death and serious injury by driving cases (unless standard).

fields.name: Band 1.1: Murder/Manslaughter
fields.description: Killing of a child (16 years old or under); killing of two or more persons; killing of a police officer, prison officer or equivalent public servant in the course of their duty; killing of a patient in a medical or nursing care context; corporate manslaughter; manslaughter by gross negligence; missing body killing.

fields.name: Band 11.1: Burglary & Robbery
fields.description: Aggravated burglary, burglary with intent to GBH or rape, and armed robbery.

fields.name: Band 1.2: Murder/Manslaughter
fields.description: Killing done with a firearm; defendant has a previous conviction for murder; body is dismembered (literally), or destroyed by fire or other means by the offender; the defendant is a child (16 or under).

fields.name: Band 12.1: Firearms Offences
fields.description: Possession or supply of a firearm/ammunition with any ulterior intent or any offence for which the maximum penalty is life imprisonment.

fields.name: Band 13.1: Other offences against the person
Band 14.1: Exploitation / human trafficking offences
fields.description: All exploitation / human trafficking offences (unless standard

fields.name: Band 16.1: Regulatory Offences
fields.description: Health and safety or environmental cases involving one or more fatalities or defined by the HSE or EA as a category or Stage 1 “major incident”; Death of a child; A major accident at a site regulated by the Control of Major Accident Hazards Regulations 1999 (as amended); large scale explosion.

fields.name: Band 16.2: Regulatory Offences
fields.description: Health and safety or environmental cases not falling within Band 1 but involving: - Serious and permanent personal injury/disability and/or widespread - Destruction of property (other than that owned or occupied by the defendant) - Extensive pollution/irreparable damage to the environment - Toxic gas release (e.g. carbon monoxide, chlorine gas) - Cases involving incidents governed by mining/railways/aviation legislation

fields.name: Band 17.1: Standard Cases
fields.description: Those cases not falling under the above categories of offence will be defined as 'Standard Cases'.

fields.name: Band 2.1: Terrorism
fields.description: Terrorist murder (S63B Terrorism Act 2000); Explosive Substances Act 1883 offences - especially S2&3; preparation for terrorism, S5 Terrorism Act 2000, disseminating terrorist publications, S2 Terrorism Act 2006; possession of material for the purpose of terrorism, S57 Terrorism Act 2000.

fields.name: Band 3.1: Serious Violence
fields.description: Attempted murder of a child, two or more persons, police officer, nursing/medical contact or any violent offence committed with a live firearm.

fields.name: Band 3.4: Serious Violence
fields.description: All other serious violence (unless standard, or specified in Band 3.5).

fields.name: Band 3.5: Serious Violence
fields.description: s20 Offences Against the Persons Act cases, s47 cases (Actual Bodily Harm), and Threats to Kill.

fields.name: Band 4.1: Sexual Offences (children) - defendant or victim a child at the time of offence
Band 4.2: Sexual Offences (children) - defendant or victim a child at the time of offence
Band 4.3: Sexual Offences (children) - defendant or victim a child at the time of offence
Band 6.1: Dishonesty (to include Proceeds of Crime and Money Laundering)
Band 6.2: Dishonesty (to include Proceeds of Crime and Money Laundering)
Band 6.3: Dishonesty (to include Proceeds of Crime and Money Laundering)
Band 6.4: Dishonesty (to include Proceeds of Crime and Money Laundering)
Band 6.5: Dishonesty (to include Proceeds of Crime and Money Laundering)
Band 7.1: Property Damage Offences
fields.description: Arson with intent to endanger life/reckless as to endanger life.

fields.name: Band 7.2: Property Damage Offences
fields.description: Simple arson and criminal damage over £30,000.

fields.name: Band 8.1: Offences Against the Public Interest
fields.description: All offences against the public interest (unless standard).

fields.name: Band 9.1: Drugs Offences
fields.description: Class A: Importation S3 Misuse of Drugs Act/ S170 Customs and Excise Management Act; Or over 5,000 pages of evidence; Or weight over: 5kg heroin or cocaine 10,000 ecstasy tablets 250,000 squares of LSD

fields.name: Band 9.2: Drugs Offences
fields.description: Class B: Importation S3 Misuse of Drugs Act/ S170 Customs and Excise Management Act; Or over 5,000 pages of evidence; Or weight over: 20kg amphetamine 200kg cannabis 5kg ketamine

fields.name: Band 9.3: Drugs Offences
fields.description: Class C: Importation S3 Misuse of Drugs Act/ S170 Customs and Excise Management Act; Or over 5,000 pages of evidence

fields.name: Band 9.4: Drugs Offences
fields.description: Class A: 1,000 pages of evidence; Or weight over: 1kg Heroin or Cocaine 2,000 ecstasy tablets 2,5000 squares of LSD

fields.name: Band 9.5: Drugs Offences
fields.description: Class B: 1,000 pages of evidence; Or weight over: 4kg of amphetamine 40kg of cannabis 1kg ketamine

fields.name: Band 9.7: Drugs Offences
fields.description: All other drugs cases of any class (unless standard).

fields.name: B
fields.description: Offences involving serious violence or damage and serious drug offences

fields.name: C
fields.description: Lesser offences involving violence or damage, and less serious drug offences

fields.name: D
fields.description: Serious sexual offences and offences against children

fields.name: I
fields.description: Offences against public justice and similar offences
